intro: Achyrocline saturejoides var. lanosa, commonly known as the hairy achyrocline, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
